intro: Arrabidaea calodictyos, commonly known as the Cape Flats daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant typically grows in coastal and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, linear seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Arrabidaea calodictyos is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
